Reviews.Title: “Ryan at the front desk makes this place inviting.”
Reviews.Author: Dawn B
Reviews.Content: I am staying 13 days here, this is my 10th. It is located at 1-17, close to the 101, so easy to get places. The pool is great, there is also a hot tub and a 1 1/2 foot deep cold pool Breakfast runs from 7-9am, it is continental, but more than just bread and a toaster. I arrived too early for the 3pm check-in and was met at the front desk by Ryan who allowed me to check in early and gave me a cookie and some bottled water. He is always smiling, very helpful, and very knowledgeable about how to get places and what to find there. The rooms are modern, comfortable, and clean, big flat screen TVs, fridge, and microwave. I have a ground floor which i like for loading in luggage etc. Maintenance guys are always working around the property keeping it nice. It is about to be re-paved. There is nothing around here to walk to except for a 7-11. Unlike other hotels, there is not coffee available except as breakfast, but they will give you extra coffee for your room. Today I found out that the hotel across the street has a Starbucks. I kind of wish that I had known that 10 days ago, but it is good to know now. The exercise room could use some additions, there is a bike, 2 treadmills, and a climber. No weights at all. This place is about half-way between Glendale and Scottsdale, both places of which I have been 3 times, so it is convenient. There have been lots of kids in the pool on certain days. The weather has been around 90 degrees. Great WiFi, no code to put in. Phoenix has so much accomodation to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a La Quinta traveler
Reviews.Content: We originally made reservations for a Days Inn on another part of town that was COMPLETELY unstayable! My son's baseball team were staying across the street at the Embassy and they didn't have any more rooms, so we went with Days Inn, which is usually a desent place. NOT in PHEONIX North!!! We walked over to the La Quinta as desperate soul's to see if they had any openings so we could check out of the HELL HOLE we were currently at. The front desk was SO nice! Their pool was fantastic. The morning breakfeast was lovely. We were saved by La Quinta! We will stay here each time we come back during Spring Break and I'll look for them in all my travels from here on out!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benique12
Reviews.Content: This was a great family hotel, we went in march and our kids loved the heated pool. They also have a kiddy pool however that one isn't heated, and a large nice jacuzzi. Overall the hotel was great, nice beds and pillows, with a good location. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LaQuinta Phoenix North”
Reviews.Author: fltraveler41
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in excellent shape and had a pretty decent pool and spa area. The value is excellent! Other hotels in the area are at least twice as much! Close to the interstate so it was quick to get on and around the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Economical, decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: InsideTrack
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this motel as an inexpensive, no-frills place to stay for a few nights. We got exactly that. I haven't stayed in a motel in decades so it took a bit of getting used to. Most nights, we were able to park right outside of our room. The exterior is well cared for and clean. The inside was fairly simple, but most of all was clean. Shower was fine and the beds were clean. Not much to tell you since there's not much in the room, lol. But I would recommend this motel if you are looking mainly for a place to crash at night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in North Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: sandiaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this LaQuinta. I have found this chain to be mostly excellent, and this one didn't change my mind. With the LQ Rewards, I only showed ID and my Rewards card and I was checked in!! Check-out was just as easy. Gave my room number, and bill was printed out. The room was large; we got a converted room that had been handicapped, so everything was in the one room. We had only this one complaint. Will request back or courtyard next time. Service was prompt and very friendly. Needed a light bulb replaced in the bathroom, and maintenance was there in 5 minutes. We have stayed at other north valley hotels, and have been extremely disappointed. This one will be our stay every time we journey to Phoenix. Forgot to mention, great rates!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & Warm Waffles for Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: vapr12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Quinta in August 2011. The staff and service was excellent! Very friendly people! The room was, unexpectedly, large and clean with a large vanity area outside the bathroom. The air conditioning ran cool for me and was a little hard to set to my liking. It was too warm to shut it off, so I blocked some of the air coming out with the large chair in the room. I enjoyed the pool. Even though it was extremely hot out, the pool was cool and refreshing. There is not much offered for shade which would be a nice addition. I did come back from the pool one day and found that my room key did not work. The staff at the desk quickly replaced it. A continental breakfast is offered which is more than the usual small danish and coffee. There is even a waffle maker to make your own warm waffles (my favorite!) I have family close by and the location was very convenient. There is a 7-Eleven across the street for quick supplies. There was a microwave, larger-than-a-cube refrigerator and a coffee maker. Staff at La Quinta recommended a car shuttle service to and from the airport which worked great, except that they were a little later than their stated pick-up time. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As expected from La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: I only have one complaint about this place.....and that is the road noise. Just ask to stay closer to the front desk and away from the Starbucks side. Other then that, I always have good luck with La Quinta and this was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Blood stains, smoky rooms and police raid.”
Reviews.Author: Whamgirl
Reviews.Content: If you like to stay in drug ridden hotels, this is perfect! The first room has the stinch of smoke and dirt along with what looked like a huge blood stain by the front door. The 2 nd room they put us in was not much better, as we woke up to a huge police raid and coroner in the room directly above us. The woman at the front desk dismissed it as "not our fault". This is not a place for families or 8 year olds as ours got a real education. STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vurt69
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our Coast to Coast trip. The price was unbeatable, front desk staff was friendly,check-in was fast (they had our keys ready even before we got there!). The room was clean and spacious with fridge, microwave, nice TV. Most rooms face a nice and well maintained courtyard with pool (adult pool, kiddie pool and jacuzzi). The breakfast area was well stocked and there was plenty of seating. The hotel is located only minutes drive from a main road with many restaurants. They have a small pet area with bags and there is a wider field (belonging to some neighboring company) where you can play fetch... I only gave it a 4 out of 5 because it is located in a neighborhood that looked a little shady.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away but close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: ScottyG777
Reviews.Content: As a La Quintaphile I chose yet another La Quinta Inn for my stay in Phoenix. I mean come on, how can you not stay at a La Quinta Inn when you're in the southwest?! I would stay here again on my next trip without hesitation. As always, the folks at the front desk were super nice at check-in and once I got into my room and got situated, only then did I look out the window to see that I was overlooking the pool. It was tempting, in the 111 degree heat, to go outside and lounge around with a few other brave souls but I had work to do, unfortunately. I went back out to the car to head downtown to my assignment and was surprised to have someone calling out to me from the sidewalk asking if I could help them out.. with some cash.. That made me feel a bit uneasy as it's never happened before, not even in NYC or Chicago or some other big urban area where one might expect it. But, he seemed nice enough and not threatening what so ever. I never encountered anything like this again, not even in downtown Phoenix walking around by myself at night. It was a once-in-a-million thing and I just mention it because it was so surprising. It could have happened in Omaha or Miami or Fargo or literally anywhere and doesn't reflect anything negative about Phoenix. There are people in need in every city in this country and this gentleman was just that, a gentleman. The breakfast was good here with a couple of local flavors and twists on the usual fare, which was a nice change from the standard spread. They had a lot to choose from and everything was clean, well-stocked, and organized; nice work. The room itself was as clean as it gets and was well-stocked and equiped and everything worked perfectly. The bed was also perfect. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and hope to be back in beautiful Phoenix sometime soon. I didn't have a fraction of the time I would have liked to spend in this great, historic, vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, But, You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: kittyjss
Reviews.Content: This was our Spring Break trip 2011, we have family in Peoria, AZ, so this hotel was close to where we needed to be. We had an excellent weekly rate and couldn't pass it up. Upon reading the reviews, we thought this was a great choice. They have a pool and hot tub which our young daughter was interested in. We had a long flight from St. Louis to LA, then to Phoenix. It was a tiring day because we have to drive 3 hours to St. Louis, then a four-hour flight to LA then another nearly hour-long flight to Phoenix. When we arrived in Phoenix, one of our bags was missing, so we had to wait to deal with that, then wait for a rental car. We finally arrived at the hotel after 10 PM, which would be midnight Central Time, our key did not work, had to go to the office and get another one. While waiting outside for my husband I noticed the paint was chipping on the building and it was very dated. It was not a good first impression. Then we entered the room and smelled strongly of smoke--it was a non-smoking room. I was not pleased with that at all. Really, I only noticed the smell the first night. After the first night, things were better. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. They had our bag from the airport the next morning. My daughter loved this hotel, especially the large pool and hot tub. The pool area is very nice, and there is a covered patio to eat breakfast outside. The free breakfast is small, they have yogurt, fruit, cereal and make you own waffles. It got very crowded in there each day. The beds were small, but comfortable. The room was quiet and the service was great. They could just use an update. I'm sure this was a very nice hotel 20 yars ago.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: john k
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a headache from the start. First thing my room key doesn't work. They have no respect for there guests. I was repeatedly woken up by knocking at my door from the hotel maintenance. The only good thing here is the t.v.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: kedmnr
Reviews.Content: The room was clean! We had to ask to get the sheets cleaned, which they did! We were able to sit outside our room to enjoy the sunshine, and visit with family. Everyone was very helpful, polite, and friendly. We would recommend this hotel. We had food delivered, it was very good, very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for little money”
Reviews.Author: Rosi1958
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta Inn is great. We stayed there twice - so far - and are very happy with it. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. All the staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfast is quite nice. Yes, it's not the bacon and eggs type, but for the price, it was delicious. The coffee is strong -- and I mean STRONG, not that watered down stuff one gets other places, and they have real milk, not that fake creamer stuff. The breakfast area is clean and friendly looking. Wasn't able to enjoy the pool because we got in late that night and had an appointment early next morning, but the water looked really crystal clear and some people enjoyed the hot tub. You know all the talk about hotels with bed bugs! Well, I checked really good to make sure that there were none. No Bed Bugs anywhere! You can't beat that peace of mind. The rooms are a little on the small side but you only sleep in there and not have a party - right. When I made the reservation online I put on there that I needed a room on the ground floor because I have problems walking. Many other places do not pay much attention to those statements but this La Quinta Inn did. I was called and asked if they could upgrade me to a king bed from two standard because there were no more standard ones available on the ground floor. The upgrade even had a fridge and microwave in the room! The bathroom was old but clean and had sufficient towels in it. When I have to go to my next appointment I will definetely book a room at this La Quinta Inn again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place At Last!!”
Reviews.Author: Marclar2000
Reviews.Content: Room was ready on time. They did not loose my reservation,(like some other chains). Clean room, Clean Pool, Clean Parking lot (Well lighted). Friendly, polite, helpful people. Shower worked. Refrigerator was clean, ditto Microwave. If the only negative I can come up with is that the tint was a little off on the TV, I had a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average quality in older style La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: Lutefisks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many La Quinta's. The nice ones have interior hallways to access the room. This one has the old style exterior entrance. They cheapened the experience by going sparse on room amenities (no lotion or conditioner). This location shows wear and could stand a remodel. They have a workout room but don't open it until 7 AM. The first morning they did not provide any fruit for breakfast but did the second morning. This location has a nice pool and an extremely friendly desk staff. Unless you come here to get a head start on the Grand Canyon drive or to watch baseball in Peoria, you can find newer La Quinta's elsewhere in the Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Risky,UNSAFE,no security cameras”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned-Traveler88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here few days and was very dissappointed with quality of the room. Lots of shady people hanging out on the balconies in front of room doorways. had some valuable things missing from the room when returned after just 20mins away! Never leave anything valuable here in the room unattended. We will not set foot into this property until they improve security and protect guest from crime.

Reviews.Title: “LQ stands for Leave Quickly”
Reviews.Author: Armywife97
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 YO daughter and I were first time visitors to Arizona. We arrived very late on a Friday and wanted somewhere to stay that was a short distance from the airport, but located on I17 because of our travel plans for the next day. After reading the reviews on here I decided that this would be the perfect fit for what I needed. I couldn't have been more WRONG. Because of flight times and picking up the rental car we didn't arrive until very early Saturday am. The first thing I notice is the security guard patroling the parking lot and how run down the outside looked. I think someone in a previous post mentioned skid row. This, in my opinion fits that description. While checking in the TV is blaring a movie. While standing there, I heard the F word (several times) coming from the TV. I glanced at it and back at the clerk. She looks at me and says that she doesn't know what movie this is, but that it's not appropriate to be watching (You think?) and turns the volume down. Thankfully my daughter was in the car with my husband or I would have said something. I get all the stuff filled out and the clerk begins explaining where our rooms are located. Since she didn't mention where the elevators were located (it's a 2 story hotel) I asked where they were. She informed me they don't have any. Seriously? I couldn't believe it. I thought that because of the Americans with Disabilites act that an elevator was a must. The only reason it was a big deal was that we had 2 huge suitcases and the idea of having to take them up steps as tired as we were wasn't appealing. I reminded myself that we most likely got the last room available and to suck it up. Then the hunt for the room began. What a huge mess. They have three seperate buildings and none are clearly marked as to which rooms are where. My daughter and I literally walked around for 5 minutes before the security guard found us and pointed us in the general vicinity of our room. Even he wasn't really clear where our room was. What good is a security guard if he doesn't even know where all the rooms are located? So, we find the room and then I decide I really need a bottle of water, but I don't have the right change for the machine. I head to the lobby to get change. Once in the lobby, I notice that the TV volume is back up to blaring on the same movie that was "inappropriate" just a few minutes ago. The room was OK and served our purpose of needing some where to sleep for a few hours before continuing on our journey. I didn't see any mold or bugs and the room appeared to be clean. The hotel is located right off of the freeway and there were several chain restaurants at the next exit for food. Nothing right near the hotel. They do offer a light breakfast, which we opted not to partake in so I can't comment on that. We also didn't hear any of the freeway traffic, but that could be because of our being tired. The price was OK for what we got. All the entrances are from the outside and depending on which side of the motel you get placed on, you may not be able to see your car out your window. Because we had a rental car we like to keep an eye on it for obvious reasons. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. All I can say is buyer beware. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple, easy access to the 17 and very affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Reelgoodgirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I took a quick road trip to Phoenix to see friends in the north area of Phoenix. I found the rates more competitive than other hotels and the rooms were simple but very clean.They offered a nice continental breakfast too! I'll keep this hotel in mind for the next Phoenix visit. FYI, the La Quinta website offered the best rates online!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Seetraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location!! Scottsdale is only 10 - 15 minutes away - literally you drive down one road and you hit Scottsdale Road. The airport is about 20 -30 minutes away. Rooms are normal, bedding needs to be replaced as it was coming off whenever I sat on the bed and the bedskirt was torn at the hems. Overall basic room; free breakfast and they have shuttle service to/from the airport - need to check their timings as it's not 24 hr.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully average”
Reviews.Author: Vegan_Traveler7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and was happy to find a decent place to stay for under $100 in the high season. This is an average place but with little niceties that made me enjoy the one night stay. My room was clean, the staff was friendly and helped me when I had trouble connecting to the internet. Breakfast had a nice spread including make your own waffles and the typical cereal, oatmeal, toast, pastries, bagels, etc... The grounds were pleasant, with fountains and a pool and the neighborhood felt safe. My only complaint was that some patrons were being loud at a late hour, but it sounded like the staff dealt with the situation. The hotel wasn't really close to anything (except the airport), but not too far from downtown, Tempe, and Scottsdale where I was heading. I'd stay here again if I ever go to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Good”
Reviews.Author: gatr
Reviews.Content: Great economical motel. I booked based on some other reviews from some other Website, where it got good reviews. You also have to understand that I spent the 4 previous nights at the JW Marriott Desert Ridge, so this was quite a change, however, I found the rooms clean, new paint and new carpet, The first night I found out that I did not have heat at about 11pm and I called the desk and told them I did not want to move. They immediately took 50% off, which I thought was generous. I then moved the next night to a bigger room with a king bed and the room had a microwave and refrig. Now, my girlfriend gets here tonight and she is used to something like the JW and I wonder what she will say. She best not say much or she can pay the difference and move us. The La Quinta also has a nice pool area and is in a nice middle class neighborhood where I went jogging this morning. I was very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine.”
Reviews.Author: lizziebarf
Reviews.Content: This place was just fine. We stayed 2 nights and returned home today (Dec. 3 2006). It is your average motel. Clean, quiet enough, and no problems. Very convienient to I17 and all of Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to describe what happened here in our 7 hour stay, but this hotel should be stripped of it's La Quinta brand because of the condition of the property and the experience of staying there. It was more like an S.R.O. on Skid Row than anything else. We felt afraid and the behavior of the security detail made us feel worse. It was very scary to stay here. The hotel does have criminal activity and the police were there during our very short stay. The ad also claimed "newly remodeled" which is why we chose it from a coupon book while we were still 120 miles away. When we got there, the place was filthy - especially the exterior - and not "remodeled." The door didn't shut snuggly, so it was like trying to sleep in a toll booth on the interstate. If I stood up and put my weight against the door, then most of the noise stopped. We didn't sleep at all. The next morning when I insisted that no one else could be put in that room until the door was fixed, the maintenence man dismissively said "they're all like that." Also, when we arrived they wouldn't honor the coupon price because they said it "was a holiday" - even though it was early/mid December and the coupon was valid December 1 through February. After we saw the room, they wouldn't let us check out and we were too tired to start driving again to look for another place after driving 15 hours. This hotel should be shut down.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Phoenix North
HotelInfo.Address: 2510 West Greenway Road, Phoenix, AZ 85023
